intro: Rhexia psammophila, commonly known as sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This herbaceous perennial typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils, often in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its showy, clustered flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in late summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor environments.
